intro: Reseda inodora, commonly known as sweet everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Reseda inodora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
